TopicTitle: Game stretches to fit screen when not in native resolution. I don't want that.

Articles.Content: The new version of KSP runs fine on my computer at 1024 x 768 (this is on my crappy Intelgrated Laptop. My good computer is at home, I'm at school.) Anyhow, in the last version of the game, when I set the game to run in fullscreen, the game would letterbox the screen. This meant no weird issues with stretching. With 0.90, the game now stretches 1024 x 768 to 1366 x 768. I don't like the stretching, and I can't play in windowed mode with the toolbar in the way at the bottom of the screen. Is there a way to make the game letterbox like it did in 0.25?
I seem to have semi-solved this by using -popupwindow, but it's not quite what I want. I want it to look like it does with -popupwindow, except the rest of the screen is black. Any ideas?

Interesting. I've not heard of the fact that KSP would letterbox. I'm guessing this has something to do with the Unity update.

Is there any reason you can't set the KSP resolution to 1366 x 768? That would make sense if you're wanting to run full screen anyway.

Also, I now see your other post:http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/103359-UI-Fails-in-OpenGL-Mode
